definition: enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand

sentences.english: The antagonism he felt towards his old enemy was still very strong.
sentences.chinese: 他对夙敌的仇恨仍然十分强烈。

sentences.english: Nikky: yes, but he is a foe to the Frenchmen .
sentences.chinese: 塞内加尔队的教练肯定是法国人的夙敌了。

sentences.english: India, Pakistan’s traditional foe, could also turn disaster into opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 巴基斯坦的夙敌印度还可以将灾难变成机遇。

sentences.english: Pepsi and coke have been arch-rivals for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 可口可乐和百事可乐已夙敌了很久。

definition: an old grudge/old scores to settle
(of enemies) cannot live under the same sky/absolutely irreconcilable
to fight to one's last gasp
opponent/substantial adversary/worthy match/antagonist/in the enemy's hands
when the enemies come face to face, their eyes blaze with hatred (idiom)
pinyin: chou2 ren2 xiang1 jian4 , fen4 wai4 yan3 hong2

definition: the two cannot exist together (idiom); irreconcilable differences/incompatible standpoints
